metadata.feature_description: Automatically authenticate users based on their IP address ranges

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Configure single IP address for auto-authentication

steps.action: Navigated to Settings > Extensions > Authentication Systems > DNNPro_ActiveDirectoryAuthentication > Site Settings
steps.expected: Auto-login IP Address field should be visible
steps.actual: Auto-login IP Address field is visible and accessible

steps.action: Entered single IP address '192.168.1.100' in Auto-login IP Address field
steps.expected: IP address should be accepted in the field

steps.actual: Settings were saved successfully, IP address retained in field

steps.action: Entered IP range '192.168.1.1-192.168.1.254' in Auto-login IP Address field
steps.expected: IP range format should be accepted
IP range should be saved successfully
steps.actual: IP range was saved successfully, value retained after page refresh

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Configure multiple IP ranges separated by semicolons

steps.action: Entered multiple IP ranges '192.168.1.1-192.168.1.100;10.0.0.1-10.0.0.50;172.16.0.100' in Auto-login IP Address field
steps.expected: Multiple IP ranges separated by semicolons should be accepted
steps.actual: Multiple IP ranges were entered successfully

steps.expected: Multiple IP ranges should be saved successfully
steps.actual: Multiple IP ranges were saved successfully, all values retained

steps.action: Entered invalid IP address '192.168.1' (only 3 octets instead of required 4) in Auto-login IP Address field
steps.expected: Invalid IP format should be detected
steps.actual: Invalid IP '192.168.1' was entered in the field

steps.expected: Validation should prevent saving invalid IP address
steps.actual: The invalid IP was displayed with red highlighting indicating validation failure

steps.action: Reloaded the settings page to verify invalid IP was not persisted
steps.expected: Invalid IP should not have been saved
steps.actual: Auto-login IP Address field is empty, confirming validation prevented the invalid IP from being saved

observations: The IP validation logic in Settings.ascx.cs correctly validates that IP addresses have 4 octets (checks for 3 dots separating the octets)
The CheckEnteredIPAddr() method validates both single IPs and IP ranges with hyphen delimiter
Multiple IP ranges can be separated by semicolons as documented
Validation prevents saving of invalid IP addresses by returning early from UpdateSettings()
The code also validates that each part of the IP range has valid format using Utilities.GetIP4Address()
